newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: PRESS DIGEST - Ireland - January 7.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Ireland - January 7.

text.p: Following are the highlights of stories reported in the Irish press on Tuesday:

- Authorities at Dublin's Mountjoy prison were adamant that they had made no concessions to the six prisoners at the centre of the jail crisis to secure the safe release of four hostages. The four hostages were set free last night.
- The minimum school leaving age should be progressively raised to 18 years from 15, a consultants' study of the education system said.
- Nobel Prize winner Seamus Heaney has scooped the prestigious Whitbread poetry award for his first new collection for five years -- the Spirit Level.

- The construction industry is heading for six billion in activity during 1997 as profit margins recover from the trough 1.5 percent average figure reported by leading companies as recently as two years ago.
- Over 150 million punts in Irish beef and cattle exports to Egypt face the axe after Cairo importers yesterday cancelled contracts over BSE fears.
- Police and troops are on full alert in Northern Ireland amid fears of loyalist retaliation for yesterday's IRA rocket attack on the High Court in Belfast.
- Ireland's longest prison siege ended late last night when six prisoners holding four prison officers hostage surrendered and released the hostages unharmed.
